# activate(options:)

**Instance Method**

Attempts to activate the application using the specified options.

## Declaration

```swift
func activate(options: NSApplication.ActivationOptions = []) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **options**: The options to use when activating the application. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/ActivationOptions] for the possible values.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the application was activated successfully, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

This method will return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if the application has quit, or is not a type of application than can be activated.

## Activating applications

- **activate(from:options:)**: Attempts to activate the application using the specified options.
- **isActive**: Indicates whether the application is currently frontmost.
- **NSApplication.ActivationOptions**: The following flags are for [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activate(options:)].
- **activationPolicy**: Indicates the activation policy of the application.
- **NSApplication.ActivationPolicy**: Activation policies (used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activationPolicy]) that control whether and how an app may be activated.
